title: Dow futures shoot up 200 points as U.S. crude rallies
text: U.S. stock index futures shot higher Tuesday night as U.S. crude prices rallied. Dow Jones Industrial Average futures YM00, +0.71% were last up 200 points, or 0.8%, while S&P 500 futures ES00, +0.88% and Nasdaq-100 futures NQ00, +1.20% each gained more than 1%.

title: Asia shares cautious ahead of Fed, corporate earnings
text: Asian shares were cautiously higher on Wednesday as investors paused ahead of the U.S. Federal Reserve's policy decision while oil prices jumped on hopes demand will pick up as many countries lift some of the coronavirus-related restrictions.

title: Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson says he likes banks, consumer stocks as economic recovery begins
text: "That's not saying anything bad about Google or the large cap growth stocks ... but they just don't have the upside potential that some of these other laggard areas do," Morgan Stanley's Mike Wilson said.

title: On The Rebound: Industries To Watch (and Avoid) As Markets Move Higher
text: As this recovery progresses, investors should emphasize long-term growth sectors and stocks and avoid areas of the market that are likely to lag.

title: The Fed's massive response to the coronavirus crisis in one chart
text: Bank of America's Mark Cabana tracks the Federal Reserve's Treasury and mortgage-backed securities purchases during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The Fed may provide more details on the policy 'bazooka' it fired to help markets
text: The Fed is not expected to adjust rates but it could provide details on the unprecedented moves it has made to fight the virus impact.

title: US Indexes End Lower Tuesday (April 28)
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 24,101.55 on Tuesday with a loss of 32.23 points or -0.13%.

title: Coming U.S. shale results will test extent of oil hedges, output cuts
text: As low crude oil prices leave U.S. producers struggling to eke out profits, investors will focus on production hedges and cost-cuts to determine winners from losers as first quarter earnings roll out in coming days.

text: CNBC's Steve Liesman reports the site for the Federal Reserve conference at Jackson Hole is closed for 2020.

text: The Federal Reserve has reached out to investment and retail banks for feedback on its Main Street lending program ahead of its formal launch, according to people familiar with the matter.

text: ...this year’s federal budget shortfall, even without additional stimulus, will be greater than the total federal debt when Bill Clinton took office. It’s also the largest budget shortfall in U.S.

title: Wall Street down on flight from techs; move to value limits loss on Dow, S&P 500
text: Wall Street's major indexes lost ground on Tuesday as investors moved out of market-leading growth stocks, though a rotation into cyclical value stocks indicated hopes of economic revival as states began to relax restrictions enacted to fight the deadly COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Wall Street Turns Red on Tuesday (April 28)
text: U.S. stocks were in the red on Tuesday, with tech stocks leading the decline. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.13% to 24,103, the S&P 500 Index declined 0.44% to 2,865 and the Nasdaq Composite Index dipped 1.34% to 8,613.

title: Strategas Research Partners' Chris Verrone on state of the markets
text: Chris Verrone, Strategas Research Partners joins "Closing Bell" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: Stocks Languish As Investors Await FOMC Meeting This Week
text: Markets slumped today after reaching fresh extended trading session highs, and now investors are awaiting the Federal Reserve meeting this week, where some key economic decisions could sway markets. After an emergency meeting of Federal Reserve policymakers in mid-March, chairman Jay Powell showed confidence in the Fed’s ability to protect the US economy from the [.

title: Stock Market Today: Mega-Cap Earnings on Deck; Zoom Picks Oracle
text: Ford's looking to reopen soon. Tesla's Musk is set for a huge payday soon.

title: Rockefeller Capital CEO Fleming on Small-Business Loans, Proposed M&A Ban
text: Greg Fleming, chief executive officer of Rockefeller Capital Management, discusses small business loan programs and his opposition to the proposed ban on mergers and acquisitions with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Davis Advisors Help Investors Focus on Long-Term Opportunities
text: As investors consider the current investment landscape and related investing risks, many are looking to long-term exchange traded fund opportunities. In the recent webcast, Navigating Today’s Uncertain Market: Opportunities, Risks & Keeping Emotions in Check, Chris Davis, Portfolio Manager and Chairman, Davis Advisors, outlined the current short-term uncertainties against long-term probabilities.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Tuesday (April 28)
text: A decline in tech shares pressured the broader market, offsetting the enthusiasm about the prospects of reopening the economy.

title: Indexes drop as investors rotate from growth to value stocks
text: Wall Street's major indexes lost ground on Tuesday as investors moved out of market-leading growth stocks, though a rotation into cyclical value stocks could point to hopes of economic revival as states begin to relax restrictions enacted to halt the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stocks give up early gains to end lower as investors weigh rush to reopen economies
text: U.S. stocks gave up early gains to close mostly lower on Tuesday as investors gird for a slew of corporate earnings and the possibility that resuming normal economic activity could reignite coronavirus infection rates.

title: Stocks Turn Negative As Dow Ends 4-Day Winning Streak
text: Stocks are attempting a fifth straight session of gains.

title: Proposed Merger Ban Doesn't Make Sense, FTC Commissioner Says
text: Noah Phillips, commissioner of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, criticizes the proposed ban on mergers and acquisitions during the coronavirus pandemic for coming at a "counter-intuitive" time. He speaks with Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu and Romaine Bostick on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Strategist breaks down investing and earnings season,' We're flying blind here'
text: ClearBridge Investments Investment Strategist Jeff Schulze joins Yahoo Finance’s Seana Smith to break down the latest market action amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stock gains ebb as investors clobber tech stocks ahead of earnings
text: US stocks made a wobbly climb Tuesday as Wall Street weighed how the global economy will look once it emerges from its coronavirus-induced coma. The Dow Jones industrial average gave up an early 1.5 percent jump to trade up 115.80 points, or 0.4 percent, at 24,249.58 as of 2:13 p.m.

title: Goldman Recommends Barbell Strategy for Reopening
text: The brokerage listed three rules for equity investors and four stocks that meet the criteria.

title: Oil plummets to disasterous record low
text: Price Futures Group senior account executive Phil Flynn says he's never seen a day like this for oil prices in his career.

text: Political feuding in Washington over how to help states with virus related budget woes is weighing on the $3.8 trillion municipal market.

title: U.S. oil futures lose more than 3% for the session
text: U.S. benchmark oil futures finished with a loss of more than 3% on Tuesday-modest in comparison with the nearly 25% drop in prices seen a day earlier.

title: Stocks rise despite mixed earnings while investors weigh easing of lockdowns
text: Stock markets across the globe managed to rise on Tuesday, riding out sharp swings on Wall Street as mixed corporate earnings results and dramatic moves in oil prices delivered yet another dose of investor jitters.

title: Investment Basics: How To Not Fail
text: Inexperienced retail investors routinely lose money by implementing poorly constructed investment strategies.

title: Watch CNBC's full interview with former Dallas Fed president Richard Fisher
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team is joined by Richard Fisher, former Dallas fed president, to discuss Texas' economy, the Federal Reserve's monetary policy action and more.

title: Howard Marks on Trying to Predict the Stock Market’s Future
text: Attempting to accurately predict the short-term movements of the stock market has always been a near-impossible task.

title: Fears of surge in coronavirus death toll weigh on S&P, Nasdaq
text: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq indexes eased on Tuesday as scientists warned of an increase in U.S. coronavirus deaths if states lifted lockdowns too quickly, while healthcare stocks slumped after a sales warning from Merck.

title: S&P 500 gains modestly, warning of higher COVID-19 deaths curb recovery hopes
text: The bellwether S&P 500 index inched higher on Tuesday, with fresh warnings of a possible higher death toll from the new coronavirus and plunging consumer confidence curbing investor hopes for a near-term economic revival as states began to relax restrictions enacted to halt the pandemic's spread.

title: Gold futures fall for third straight session
text: Gold futures fell Tuesday to tally a third straight session decline. Some U.S. states have started to reopen following the shutdowns put in place to slow the spread of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Fed Survey: Trillions more dollars are needed to restart the economy
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman takes a look at the latest results of CNBC's Fed Survey as states begin to reopen their economies.

title: White House economist: Unemployment could hit 20% by June
text: The White House is telling Americans to brace for a period of Great Depression-level unemployment this summer.
